eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Diabetes diagnosis and insulin therapy
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have had a diagnosis of either: [1a] T1DM based on the World Health Organization (WHO) diagnostic criteria, and have been on the following daily insulin therapy for at least 1 year [A] multiple daily injection of long-acting insulin analog (either insulin glargine [U-100 or U-300] or insulin degludec [U-100]) and rapid-acting insulin analog (insulin lispro, insulin aspart, or insulin glulisine), or [B] continuous subcutaneous insulin infusion (CSII) Or [1b] T2DM based on the WHO diagnostic criteria, and have received the following daily insulin therapy with or without oral anti-hyperglycemic medications (OAMs) for at least 1 year [A] insulin: long-acting insulin analog (either insulin glargine [U-100 or U-300] or insulin degludec [U-100]) alone, or in combination with rapid-acting insulin analog (insulin lispro, insulin aspart, or insulin glulisine) or CSII [B] OAM: up to 3 of the following OAMs in accordance with local regulations: metformin, dipeptidyl peptidase-4 inhibitor, sodium glucose cotransporter 2 inhibitor, sulfonylurea (should not be more than half of maximum approved doses), glinides, alpha-glucosidase inhibitor, or thiazolidine

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Male contraception requirement
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: male patients: agree to use an effective method of contraception for the duration of the study and for 28 days following the last study treatment

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Female contraception and pregnancy requirements
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: female patients: [3a] women of childbearing potential who are abstinent (if this is complete abstinence, as their preferred and usual lifestyle) or in a same sex relationship (as part of their preferred and usual lifestyle) must agree to either remain abstinent or stay in a same sex relationship without sexual relationships with males. Periodic abstinence (eg, calendar, ovulation, symptothermal, post-ovulation methods), declaration of abstinence just for the duration of a trial, and withdrawal are not acceptable methods of contraception. [3b] otherwise, women of childbearing potential participating must agree to use one highly effective method (less than 1% failure rate) of contraception, or a combination of 2 effective methods of contraception for the entirety of the study. [A] women of childbearing potential participating must test negative for pregnancy prior to initiation of treatment as indicated by a negative serum pregnancy test at the screening visit followed by a negative urine pregnancy test within 24 hours prior to exposure. [B] either one highly effective method of contraception or a combination of 2 effective methods of contraception will be used. The patient may choose to use a double barrier method of contraception. Barrier protection methods without concomitant use of a spermicide are not a reliable or acceptable method. Thus, each barrier method must include use of a spermicide. It should be noted that the use of male and female condoms as a double barrier method is not considered acceptable due to the high failure rate when these methods are combined. [3c] women not of childbearing potential may participate, and include those who are: [A] infertile due to surgical sterilization (hysterectomy, bilateral oophorectomy, or tubal ligation), congenital anomaly such as mullerian agenesis Or [B] postmenopausal, defined as either: [i] a woman at least 50 years of age with an intact uterus, not on hormone therapy, who has had either: [a] cessation of menses for at least 1 year, or [b] at least 6 months of spontaneous amenorrhea with a follicle-stimulating hormone >40 mIU/mL; or [ii] a woman 55 or older not on hormone therapy, who has had at least 6 months of spontaneous amenorrhea, or [iii] a woman at least 55 years of age with a diagnosis of menopause prior to starting hormone replacement therapy

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Age requirement
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: are between 18 and 64 years old for T1DM, or between 20 and 70 years old for T2DM at the time of informed consent

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Body mass index requirement
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have a body mass index of 18.5 to 30.0 kg/m2 for T1DM, or 18.5 to 35.0 kg/m2 for T2DM at the time of screening

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Hemoglobin A1c requirement
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have a hemoglobin A1c value ≤10% at the time of screening

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Clinical laboratory test results
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have clinical laboratory test results within normal reference range (except for glycemic parameters) for the population or investigative site, or results with acceptable deviations that are judged to be not clinically significant by the investigator

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Venous access requirement
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have venous access sufficient to allow for blood sampling and administration of insulin for IV administration as per the protocol

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Reliability and availability
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: are reliable and willing to make themselves available for the duration of the study and are willing to follow study procedures

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Informed consent
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: are able and willing to give signed informed consent

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Investigative site personnel exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: are investigative site personnel directly affiliated with this study and their immediate families. Immediate family is defined as a spouse, biological or legal guardian, child, or sibling

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Lilly employees exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: are Lilly employees

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Current clinical trial enrollment exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: are currently enrolled in a clinical trial involving an investigational product or any other type of medical research judged not to be scientifically or medically compatible with this study

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Recent clinical trial participation exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have participated, within the last 4 months, in a clinical trial involving an investigational product. If the previous investigational product has a long half-life, 4 months or 5 half-lives (whichever is longer) should have passed from the last dose of investigational product

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Previous LY900018 exposure exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have previously completed or withdrawn from this study or any other study investigating LY900018, and have previously received LY900018

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Allergies or sensitivity exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have known allergies or sensitivity to LY900018, glucagon, related compounds, or any components of the formulation, or history of significant atopy

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: ECG abnormality exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have an abnormality in the 12-lead ECG that, in the opinion of the investigator, increases the risks associated with participating in the study

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Unstable insulin regimen or blood glucose control exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: any significant changes in insulin regimen and/or unstable blood glucose control within the past 3 months prior to screening as assessed by the investigator

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: High insulin dose exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have received a total daily dose of insulin >1.2 U/kg at the time of screening

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Poorly controlled hypertension exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have poorly controlled hypertension (ie, supine systolic BP >165 mm Hg or supine diastolic BP >95 mm Hg) at screening, or a change in antihypertensive medications within 30 days prior to screening

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Pheochromocytoma or insulinoma history exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have a history of pheochromocytoma (ie, adrenal gland tumor) or insulinoma

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Severe hypoglycemia or loss of consciousness history exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have a history of an episode of severe hypoglycemia (as defined by an episode that required third party assistance for treatment) in the 1 month prior to screening or have a history of loss of consciousness within the last 2 years induced other than by hypoglycemia

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Epilepsy or seizure disorder history exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have a history of epilepsy or seizure disorder

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Significant medical disorders exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have a history or presence of cardiovascular, respiratory, hepatic, renal, gastrointestinal, endocrine (apart from T1DM or T2DM), hematological, or neurological disorders capable of significantly altering the absorption, metabolism, or elimination of drugs; of constituting a risk when taking the investigational product; or of interfering with the interpretation of data

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Psychiatric disorders exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have known or ongoing psychiatric disorders that, in the opinion of the investigator, may preclude the patient from following and completing the protocol

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Drug abuse exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: regularly use known drugs of abuse and/or show positive findings on urinary drug screening

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: HIV infection exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: show evidence of human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection and/or positive HIV antibodies and/or antigen

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Hepatitis C exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: show evidence of hepatitis C and/or positive hepatitis C antibody

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Hepatitis B exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: show evidence of hepatitis B and/or positive hepatitis B surface antigen

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Syphilis exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: show evidence of syphilis and/or are positive for syphilis test

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Lactating women exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: are women who are lactating

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Prohibited medications exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: use of daily systemic beta-blocker, indomethacin, warfarin, anticholinergic drugs

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Blood donation exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have donated 400 mL or more blood in the last 12 weeks (males) or in the last 16 weeks (females), or any blood donation (including apheresis) within the last 4 weeks, or total volume of blood donation within 12 months is 1200 mL (males)/800 mL (females) or more at screening

eligibilityCriteria.name: Unstable insulin regimen or blood glucose control exclusion
Severe hypoglycemia or loss of consciousness history exclusion
Epilepsy or seizure disorder history exclusion
Unstable insulin regimen or blood glucose control exclusion
Severe hypoglycemia or loss of consciousness history exclusion
Epilepsy or seizure disorder history exclusion
